Reviews.Title: Fantastic, Thin Flat Panel
Reviews.Author: J. Wutt
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for 4 days so far, and I can't say enough positive about things about it.  The set up was easy, and the amount of control you have for the picture settings is very in depth.  The extra warranty of the 860 (18 months instead of 12 months for the 850) is a nice perk. The blue TOC (Touch of Color) is barely noticeable, it really looks black/graphite grey unless you look very closely.  The good news is that the 'halo effect' that some owners of the 750 have complained about is non-existent on the 860.  I also love the swivel stand because I did not wall mount this TV even though it is exceptionally thin.Plugged in my HD cable box and new Blu-ray player via HDMI and everything has worked perfectly so far.  The picture is stunning, and there are so many functions and features that I just haven't gone through all of them yet.On the flip side, there is a lag if you are using the little circle dial on the remote.  Better off just clicking up, down, left, or right instead of spinning the dial around and waiting for the TV to react.I don't have surround sound yet, but the TV speakers aren't too bad.  Hard to rave about fake surround sound from tiny TV speakers, but that's expected.Overall, I would recommend this TV without hesitation this to anyone looking for a new 1080p LCD TV.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TV!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Whitcomb "TOPDOG"
Reviews.Content: I am so impressed with this tv. Fantastic picture! 18 month warranty & was given an additional 3 months warranty for registering it online with SAMSUNG. Super thin and light weight. This unit has a very small bezel around it for a very clean look. The TOC (touch of color) is not at all noticable, I didn't want a red or blue tv in my living room. With out getting technical this is a great set, cheaper than SONY and highly rated. You won't be dissapointed, I am so happy with my purchase. 5 STARS!

Reviews.Title: BBB Warning about external vendor-Shop Digital Online
Reviews.Author: Sam Malone "Sam"
Reviews.Content: BBB Feedback on Shop Digital Online aka Crazy 4 DigitalComplaints to the BBB report that Crazy 4 Digital advertises the sale of "Brand New, Factory Sealed" electronics on its various websites but when consumers receive their products they are "Refurbished" with multiple scratches and photocopied instruction manuals and in some cases do not even operate properly. Attempts by consumers to obtain a refund or an actual brand new plasma t.v. or laptop computer are not honored by the company. Consumer reports allege that Crazy 4 Digital representatives insist that the products are new and have merely been repackaged by the manufacturer. Consumers also report being told that the item they ordered is in stock when in fact it is on backorder.Customer Experience: Based on BBB files, this business has an unsatisfactory record with the Bureau, because there is a pattern of complaints, and the business has not corrected the underlying reason for the complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, But Beware of Electronics Expo!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Israel A. Ramirez "IsRa"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product through Amazon from Electronics Expo. I received the TV on time, spent 5 hours setting it up with my home theater and making sure everything was perfect. The picture quality is absolutely amazing. 4 Days later while watching the basketball game, the TV made a loud popping noise and turned off. I was unable to get a picture after that. I contacted Electronics Expo thinking they would just send me a new one since the one I bought was defective. Boy, was I wrong. The person I spoke to went on for several minutes about their policy and made me feel like it was my fault the TV died. He said there was nothing they could do and asked me to call Samsung. I then contacted Samsung and was told they would need to send a service tech out to look at the TV but it would be about a week before he could come out. I had no choice so I waited, took the day off from work when he was scheduled and then he didn't even come out. He called me the day of and asked what the problem was and I told him. He said there was no need for him to come since he knew what was wrong with the TV. He said he would have to replace the panel but did not have any available and would have to order one. He said they would call me to re-schedule the service. It has now been 3 weeks and I am still without a TV. I have contacted Samsung and they tell me to call the local service center but when I do I get an answering machine. I tried contacting Electronics Expo to see if they could call Samsung on my behalf. I was made to feel like a nuisance but afetr talking to a supervisor she took my information and said she would call Samsung on my behalf and would call me back to let me know what they said. I never heard back from her. Needless to say, this purchase has been a nightmare. I had to send in my credit card payment for the purchase price of the TV already. It doesn't feel good paying over 2 grand for a product that doesn't work. I am not giving this TV a bad rating, it is a wonderful TV, but I feel its necessary to warn other people before they purchase through Electronics Expo.

Reviews.Title: Buy it!  WOW HD movies!
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: Crisp, crystal clear HD picture is my first thoughts of the 860.  The first movie I watched on my LN52A860 was The Dark Knight on blue ray.  The first scene of the movie appeared like a realistic 3D picture, so clear it was scary!  I felt like I was right there in the movie.  I've noticed that other reviews at different sites state problems with IR interference (infer red) from the back light with different remotes.  Does not effect Directv receiver or my Onkyo 706 or blue ray BDP-S550.  The TV does have slight clouding on the corners (seems like all will have slight clouding due to the slim design and the back light).  This can only be seen on black scenes. Nothing really noticeable to shake a stick at as far as clouding. Again it can only be seen on a black screen and does not effect any picture quality.  The interface is easy to use.  The auto motion Plus is really neat.  Be sure to see it in demo mode were it shows half the screen with the motion plus vs non motion plus. Warrantee:  18 months plus the 3 months added on when registered with Samsung for a total of 21 months is just awesome.  One can not really see the touch of blue color unless there is light behind it or in a really bright room.  Not too many LCD's have this clear of a picture IMO.  If you can't see an 860 on the show room check out an 850 as they are very similar as far as picture quality.  The TV can pull movies and pictures off your network if you have them on your computer to share.  Really neat to show a slide show on a 52".  No regrets here.. Very happy!

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN52A860 LCD HDTV Review
Reviews.Author: M.H. "Mike"
Reviews.Content: Beautiful TV with an exceptional HD picture. Breathtaking clarity!  Easy to set up.  Samsung has a problem with these TV's (older models as well as this newer model) in that there appears to be an incompatability problem with Comcast HD-HDMI cable boxes.  The problem is that when the TV is connected to the HD-HDMI cable box with HDMI cables, there are chronic audio drops (i.e. audio cuts out repeatedly on most channels). (No problem with Blue Ray DVD player performance) I solved the problem by searching complaint blogs and following a suggestion to use component video cables instead of HDMI cables. This works with no affect on HD performance.  But it's a shame that the product does not work "right out of the box" as any customer should expect.An additional problem I have is that the backlight does not turn on when the TV is cold (i.e. first start up in the morning or later in the day after the TV has been off for a few hours.This results in no picture, although sound is fine.  Backlight does turn on after turning off the TV and then turning it on again.  Very annoying. My Comcast technician says he has the same problem with his Panasonic LCD TV, so this may be a problem with LCD TV's.

Reviews.Title: Bob
Reviews.Author: R. Emmerling
Reviews.Content: Great TV, beautiful picture.  It's thin design and ability to swivel makes it an ideal fit for any location. Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Stunning
Reviews.Author: Stephen Smith
Reviews.Content: This TV is absolutely amazing in every aspect.  1080p on a PS3 with this TV is gorgeous.  The ToC blue is hardly noticeable unless there is a light source behind the TV (in which case the blue is quite eye catching).  Every aspect of the TV is perfect.  The Porsche of HDTVs.

Reviews.Title: STUNNING, I am very impressed!!!
Reviews.Author: T.S
Reviews.Content: The Samsung LN52A860 52" LCD television is simply incredible! I have had my TV for about 2 months now, and I could not be happier. I spent about 5 weeks searching for a new TV late last year. I looked at a variety of manufacturers, including, Sony, Pioneer, Panasonic, LG, Toshiba and some others, and it seemed that i could not find a better picture(in my eyes) than the Samsung 860. The price range is a little cheaper than Sony, for the size of a TV that you are looking for, whether it be 46", 52" or larger. The 1080p resolution, the 120Hz motion speed option, the 50,000:1 dynamic contrast,(for some reason, the Sony Bravia TV's do not list the contrast ratio on their models?) and the 4MS response time are all the latest technical features that give you the best possible picture availiable now. The older Samsung models such as the 750, 650 and 550 series are not nearly as clear as the 860 series, and from what i have read, have had technical issues in the past. This TV has so many picture options and adjustments(some adjustments are not really noticeable) that it takes a couple days to go through the manual, this allows you to customize your picture to however you like it! The TV is only 1.5 inch thick or about 60LBS heavy which makes any kind of wall mounting much easier then the older and much heavier models. The picture is so life like it's like looking out a window, however there is one minor problem, there is a little glare of the screen that makes daytime viewing a little more difficult. The older models such as the 650 and 550 series, are alot worse and have more glare than the 860, so you have to think, a little, about putting your TV against a wall where the sun does not shine directly onto the screen. It's not like the TV is un-watchable during the day, its just that you may have to move a little closer to the TV, to not see as much glare, during daytime viewing. You also have to consider getting a surround sound system(if you don't already have one) as with the TV only being 1.5" thick, the speakers can only be so big, to be ablt to fit in the frame, but the sound is ok from the TV if you have to use it, considering how small the speakers have to be.All in all, I am VERY happy with this TV, all my friends and family that I have shown this TV to, are as amazed at the picture quality as i am, this Samsung 860 will change the way you enjoy watching anything from sports, movies or regular network channels, ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal transaction with Electronics Expo, TV is awesome

Reviews.Content: I am truly satisfied with this purchase.  The TV is simply awesome.  I made a home-built antenna for this TV and I'm receiving crystal clear digital programming over the air.The design of this unit is truly well thought out. The controls are outstanding. It's technically quite advanced.  Just think about it:  you can stream a video signal over ethernet to this TV from your computer.  That's something!

I also saved over a 1000 dollars from amazon  instead of going to best buy.  THANKS.  If you want the best LCD. THIS IS IT. picture is breath-taking. warrenty is great! 18 months.  Buy this TV,  You wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: Best Samsung I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Rico
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV when i was in Iraq. Sent it to my parents house just wks before coming home. I set this TV up right when i got home. Works beautifully! I havent upgraded TV cause I have no issues with this one. A couple yrs now have past and TV still works like when i first bought it. No issues at all!!! Def a great buy if you want a big TV!

Reviews.Title: Love My TV
Reviews.Author: john sutton
Reviews.Content: I bought my Tv in early 2009 after doing a lot of research on a good quality tv. After a couple of months of searching I narrowed it down to Samsung or Sony.There seemed to be too many complaints for the Sony so, I went with Samsung. I could not be happier.This TV has one of the best pictures I have seen and I still get compliments on how "real" the picture looks. I own 8 or 9 Samsung products (TV, monitors, blu-ray player, etc) and have never had a problem. I would highly recommend this TV and Samsung to everybody.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, awesome picture, ahead of its time.
Reviews.Author: Nathan T. Nebelsick
Reviews.Content: When I bought this TV in November of 2008 I was looking for the best TV's out there. I found it with this Samsung LN52A860 TOC Blue. At the time most of the store Samsung TOC had a red bezel, not being a big fan of red I found the same series with a blue bezel. The color change cost about $100 more than the original red bezel.This TV has an awesome picture, plenty of inputs and great features. This TV was ahead of its time with 120hz, and is great for Blu-Ray movies.I would defiantly recommend this TV to anyone who is looking for one, though there are a lot newer models to choose from now.UPDATE: I moved on from this to a Samsung UN60D8000Samsung UN60D8000 60-Inch 1080p 240 Hz 3D LED HDTV (Silver) [2011 MODEL] (2011 Model) the newest model is the F series.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV with some build quality concerns
Reviews.Author: Pasha
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in February 2009 and it worked perfectly for a month, after which, the picture has disappeared.  Upon closer look (about 5 inches from the screen), I saw a very-very dim image of pictures, menus, etc.I called Samsung customer service and they have schedule the in-home service appointment within a week.  I had to take the TV off the wall per instructions of the tech support.  Upon inspection, the repairman has ordered new parts, inverter and the entire panel, as he wasn't 100% sure what has failed.In a few weeks, he came back with a new inverter, installed it and voila, the picture is back.  Not for long though... Three days later, the TV would not even turn on!  After another week of waiting, another technician came over with new parts, tried the new main board and the TV is back online.  Not for long though...After the back panel was placed back, the TV would not turn on, so the tech had to take off the back panel again.  He checked the connections and found one wire "semi"-loose.  After connecting it back, the TV worked fine and upon further checking, the new main board was not required - the problem was the loose wire from the first tech.The second issue was circumstantial; however, my previous Sony rear projection HDTV did not have issues for over 4 years, that is why I am concerned about the quality of my Samsung TV.Though my experience with this TV was not very smooth, I have to admit that it has exceptional picture quality (it was even better before the new inverter though).Pros:Picture QualityAppearance (1.9" depth)DLNA (I was able to play most of my movies over 1Gbs network)Infolink (though I don't use it too much)USB ports (Pics, movies, etc)21-month in-home warrantyCons:Questionable built qualitySomewhat convoluted menusNo picture aspect button!!!!!!!!Some back inputs might become inaccessible with some wall mounts (I lost 2 component inputs with my mount)Samsung's PC streaming server is extremely outdated and not very user friendly

Reviews.Title: Fantastic first HDTV Big Screen
Reviews.Author: Storyteller "Storyteller"
Reviews.Content: Apologies for the short review as my time is limited right now ... but ... this Samsung is bottom line awesome.  The narrow size is incredible ... the Touch of Color Blue is subtle but dynamic, and the features built into the TV are amazing.  I would caution you to shop around a little bit as the prices for this set range from $ 2,250 to over $3,000.  I paid around $2,250 for it by shopping around and timing my purchase correctly, and for $2,200 this TV is fantastic.  If I had to pay $3,000 ... well ... there are a lot of great TVs in that price range ... but few can match the picture, sound quality, size, and features of this TV for under $2,500!!

Reviews.Title: samsung LN52A860

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV.  Need I say any more.
Reviews.Author: S. Quickstad
Reviews.Content: I just want to start by saying the Samsung LN52A860 LCD is an awesome TV.  I'm not a TV guru.  But I do know what is good.  When I first started looking at buying a TV I went to all the TV review sites.  I collected all the data and listened to what everyone had to say and after about 3 months of my own searching.  It came down to either the Sony XBR8 or Samsung LN55A950.  But when it came down to it, I just couldn't see paying that kind of money.  I am very happy with my choice.  My wife and I just can't get over how good the picture and colors are.  I don't expect you to buy this TV on what I have to say.  Do your own research.  But I'll tell you this.  You won't go wrong if this TV is your choice.

Reviews.Content: I did a lot of online research prior to selecting this TV. All sources said this was an excellent tv and they were right. The clarity and richness of the colors are truely amazing. Anything in HD is spellbinding to watch.The touch of blue is not visible at all in my case.I like the swivel stand, so I can slightly adjust it from the sunlight from my windows.My only nitpick would be that the auto volume control does not work when using AV speakers for the sound.Shipping and delivery and setup was great and within a week of purchase.

Reviews.Title: Buyers Remorse...NOPE!

Reviews.Content: I've had the TV for about a week....still have not spent the time to properly understand all the numerous functions.This represents one of the few occasions that do not have buyers remorse after spending this kind of money. You're going to need at stand alone audio system.Enjoy!
